sources.source_name: Arizona Secretary of State - Charitable Organizations

charitable_registration_agency: Arizona Secretary of State - Charitable Organizations Section
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross revenue under $25,000 annually may be exempt from registration. Religious organizations and certain educational institutions are also exempt.

formation_requirements.publication_details: Notice of incorporation must be published in newspaper of general circulation three consecutive times within 60 days of filing
formation_requirements.notes: Arizona requires statutory agent (registered agent) with Arizona address. Uniquely allows single-director nonprofits. Publication requirement adds time and cost.

requirements.notes: Arizona does NOT require annual reports for nonprofit corporations, making it unique among states. However, charitable organizations must still file with Secretary of State.

requirements.filing_agency: Arizona Secretary of State - Charitable Organizations Section
required_information: Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Initial registration is free. Organizations under $25,000 gross revenue may be exempt. Registration required before soliciting.

requirements.filing_agency: Arizona Secretary of State - Charitable Organizations Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual filing is free. Due within 6 months of fiscal year end. Late filing may result in compliance action.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form 5000 - Application for Nonprofit Organization Tax Exemption
requirements.notes: Arizona has Transaction Privilege Tax (TPT) instead of sales tax. Qualifying 501(c)(3) organizations may be exempt. Not all transactions are exempt - review specific exemptions.

requirements.due_date_specifics: File by March 1st for exemption beginning the following tax year
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
requirements.notes: Property must be owned by nonprofit and used exclusively for charitable purposes. Annual affidavit required by March 1st. Contact county assessor for specific requirements.
Arizona allows raffles for nonprofits in existence 3+ years. Municipality approval required. Prize limit $100,000 per raffle. No more than 2 raffles per year.

requirements.filing_agency: Arizona Secretary of State - Charitable Organizations Section
requirements.notes: Registration is free but bond required. Each contract must be filed.
Arizona does not mandate audits by law. Best practices suggest audits for organizations over $500,000 in revenue.

special_notes.no_corporate_annual_report: Arizona does NOT require annual corporate reports for nonprofits, reducing administrative burden significantly.
special_notes.publication_requirement: Arizona requires publication of incorporation notice, adding cost and time to formation.
special_notes.single_director_allowed: Arizona allows single-director nonprofits, unusual flexibility.
special_notes.transaction_privilege_tax: Arizona uses Transaction Privilege Tax (TPT) instead of traditional sales tax.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions.
special_notes.three_year_raffle_rule: Organizations must exist for 3+ years before conducting raffles.
special_notes.free_filings: All charitable registration and professional fundraiser registration is free in Arizona.
